thread.title: The week in numbers to July 24
thread.title_full: The week in numbers to July 24

author: news.com.au
title: The week in numbers to July 24
text:
THE big and small numbers that grabbed attention - or should have - in the business world over the past week.
MONDAY: 10,000 - The wife of Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, the force behind the country's Abe-enomics, has decided to establish a beehive at their official residence. First lady Akie Abe wants hives enough for up to 10,000 Japanese honeybees, right in the centre of Tokyo.
Tuesday: 84 - Shopping centre magnate Frank Lowy, has undergone brain surgery for an injury likely sustained in his fall from the podium at the A-League soccer grand final. Mr Lowy is aged 84. Wednesday: 0.7 per cent - The price of Australian consumer goods and services jumped 0.7 per cent in the three months to June, helped by a surge in petrol prices. Thursday: 300 - The ABC will close its more than 50 bricks and mortar shops and focus on online retail in a move that will slash 300 jobs. Friday: $25 million - National Australia Bank will pay out $25 million to about 62,000 customers affected by problems with its Navigator Wrap wealth management platform.
